entries.content: Prospects raise stalls, objections, or higher authority excuses at the precise moment a salesperson attempts a traditional close.
entries.notes: Describes the typical timing of objections in a traditional sales process.

entries.content: Common stalls/objections when attempting a traditional close include 'Can you send me more information?', 'I need to discuss this internally', or 'I need to see xyz'.
entries.notes: Lists specific examples of objections/stalls encountered at the point of traditional closing.

entries.content: Objections and stalls occur because salespeople attempt to close at the wrong time, when the prospect is expecting it.
entries.notes: Identifies the speaker's perceived root cause of objections in traditional closing scenarios.

focus_area: Objection Discovery: Clarifying questions, isolation, root cause
